verses.arabic_tajweed_html: قُلْ أُوحِىَ إِلَىَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْءَانًا عَجَبًا ١
verses.bangla: Say [Prophet], ‘It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn once listened in and said, “We have heard a wondrous Quran,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشْدِ فَـَٔـامَنَّا بِهِۦ‌ۖ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدًا ٢
verses.bangla: that gives guidance to the right path, and we have come to believe it––We shall never set up partners with our Lord––

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَـٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَـٰحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا ٣
verses.bangla: and that He––exalted be the glory of our Lord!––has neither spouse nor child.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطًا ٤
verses.bangla: Outrageous things have been said about God by the foolish among us,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلْإِنسُ وَٱلْجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا ٥
verses.bangla: although we had thought that no man or jinn would [dare to] tell a lie about Him.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِّنَ ٱلْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا ٦
verses.bangla: Men have sought refuge with the jinn in the past, but they only misguided them further.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّواْ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدًا ٧
verses.bangla: They thought, as you did, that God would never raise anyone from the dead.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدْنَـٰهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا ٨
verses.bangla: We tried to reach heaven, but discovered it to be full of stern guards and shooting stars––

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَـٰعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ‌ۖ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ ٱلْأَنَ يَجِدْ لَهُۥ شِهَابًا رَّصَدًا ٩
verses.bangla: we used to sit in places there, listening, but anyone trying to listen now will find a shooting star lying in wait for him––

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِىٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا ١٠
verses.bangla: [so now] we do not know whether those who live on earth are due for misfortune, or whether their Lord intends to guide them.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّـٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٲلِكَ‌ۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدًا ١١
verses.bangla: Some of us are righteous and others less so: we follow different paths.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعْجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَن نُّعْجِزَهُۥ هَرَبًا ١٢
verses.bangla: We know we can never frustrate God on earth; we can never escape Him.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ‌ۖ فَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا ١٣
verses.bangla: When we heard the guidance we came to believe: whoever believes in his Lord need fear no loss nor injustice.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلْقَـٰسِطُونَ‌ۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُوْلَـٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوْاْ رَشَدًا ١٤
verses.bangla: Some of us submit to Him and others go the wrong way: those who submit to God have found wise guidance,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَمَّا ٱلْقَـٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُواْ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا ١٥
verses.bangla: but those who go wrong will be fuel for Hellfire.” ’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسْتَقَـٰمُواْ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَـٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقًا ١٦
verses.bangla: If they had taken to the right way, We would have given them abundant water to drink-

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: لِّنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ‌ۚ وَمَن يُعْرِضْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا ١٧
verses.bangla: a test for them––but anyone who turns away from his Lord’s Revelation will be sent by Him to spiralling torment.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّ ٱلْمَسَـٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدًا ١٨
verses.bangla: Places of worship are for God alone- so do not pray to anyone other than God-

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُواْ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا ١٩
verses.bangla: yet when God’s Servant stood up to pray to Him, they pressed in on him.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَدْعُواْ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا ٢٠
verses.bangla: Say, ‘I pray to my Lord alone; I set up no partner with Him.’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: قُلْ إِنِّى لَآ أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا ٢١
verses.bangla: Say, ‘I have no control over any harm or good that may befall you.’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: قُلْ إِنِّى لَن يُجِيرَنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًا ٢٢
verses.bangla: Say, ‘No one can protect me from God: I have no refuge except in Him.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِلَّا بَلَـٰغًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَـٰلَـٰتِهِۦ‌ۚ وَمَن يَعْصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا ٢٣
verses.bangla: I only deliver [what I receive] from God- only His messages.’ Whoever disobeys God and His Messenger will have Hell’s Fire as his permanent home:

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْاْ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا ٢٤
verses.bangla: when they are confronted by what they have been warned about, they will realize who has the weaker protector and the smaller number.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّىٓ أَمَدًا ٢٥
verses.bangla: Say, ‘I do not know whether what you have been warned about is near, or whether a distant time has been appointed for it by my Lord.’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: عَـٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا ٢٦
verses.bangla: He is the One who knows what is hidden.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرْتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسْلُكُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِۦ رَصَدًا ٢٧
verses.bangla: He does not disclose it except to a messenger of His choosing. He sends watchers to go in front and behind

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: لِّيَعْلَمَ أَن قَدْ أَبْلَغُواْ رِسَـٰلَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عَدَدَۢا ٢٨
verses.bangla: to ensure that each of His messengers delivers his Lord’s message: He knows all about them, and He takes account of everything.
